attributes.action: Change the gcse scheme back to A,B,C instead of grades 9-1 so it’s easier
attributes.background: The students currently about to take GCSEs have been studying from year 7 up to get an A+ or etc all of a sudden the mark scheme has been changed which is not fair. The government have made it too hard for them to achieve in such small time.
attributes.additional_details: We need to make it easier so more students are able to be more successful in life. Changing the grading scheme has not made it only harder for children to be more successful but has also put more stress on them as the government had only changed it recently.

attributes.action: Change the A1 license - Motorcycle
attributes.background: My suggested change is if you are 18+ Years old and obtain an A1 license you can ride a motorcycle up to a 300cc with no power greater than 23 kw (30 bhp) Restrictions can be placed on the bike. This will give people an incentive to obtain this license. Making more people do motorcycle training.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently you can obtain an A1 license at 17+ Years old Which allows you to ride a motorcycle up to a 125cc with no more power of 11kw (15 bhp) you no longer display L plates, you can carry a pillion and have access to the motorway. 

Cbt allows you to ride a motorcycle up to a 125cc with no more power of 11kw (15 bhp) as long as you display L plates front and back, don’t Carry pillions and don’t go onto the motorway.

17 year olds have no restriction on what car they can drive after passing.

attributes.action: Amend the Town and Country Planning Regulations on the flying of the EU flag
attributes.background: Under the 2007/2012 Planning Regulations flags can be flown without consent. Schedule 1 Class H allows: The flag of the Commonwealth, EU, UN, or any other international organisation of which the UK is a member. On 29/3/2019 the UK will leave the EU, hence flying the EU flag without consent must end.
attributes.additional_details:
The Town and Country Planning Regulations 2007 and amendment 2012, allows certain flags can be flown without consent, as set out within Schedule 1, Class H. 
One of these flags, the EU flag,  can be flown because it is a flag of an international organisation of which the UK is a member. From 29th March 2019 this will no longer be the case. Therefore, in future consent must be required.
The government’s guidance in “Flying flags: a plain English guide” must also be updated to reflect this change.

attributes.action: Change the law to ensure that NICE guidance outweighs the "Bolam Test"
attributes.background: I have suffered a heart attack which left me disabled. I allege this was due to sub-standard practices. However, solicitors say that my case would not meet the 'Bolam Test', in that, if a similar expert would have 'done the same thing' then a claim will fail even if NICE guidance has been ignored.
attributes.additional_details:
Nice Guidance states that “If you currently have chest pain ... you may need to go to hospital as an emergency ... if you do not currently have chest pain and your ECG was normal … you should have an assessment in hospital on the same day" 
(Solicitor's response - below) 
".. NICE guidelines are recommendations ... advice they provide should not be compared to .. many years of professional experience".

attributes.action: Repair pot holed roads by introduction of vignette system for foreign drivers
attributes.background: Many countries in Europe make road users pay to use motorways and major roads, either by way of tolls or a vignette system. I propose introducing a Vignette system in the UK for foreign drivers which would raise revenue to be shared amongst the counties and used solely for repairing road surfaces.
attributes.additional_details: Pot holes in UK roads are increasing due to councils lack of funds for repairs. This causes serious safety issues for drivers and cyclists and can cause major damage to vehicles.

attributes.action: Raise the Penalty for Uninsured Motorists
attributes.background: Currently the penalty for driving a motor vehicle with no insurance is £300 and 6 points on your license. With this being the case, millions of motorists take the gamble!
attributes.additional_details:
If you are involved in a road traffic accident that was not a fault of your own, usually the third party’s insurance would cover the damage to your vehicle and your insurance excess. If however, the third party is an uninsured driver, this then falls on you to recover your costs. 

Millions of motorists are uninsured because the penalty for doing so is not severe enough. A £300 fine is cheaper than most annual insurance quotes!

The fine should be more severe to prevent this from happening.

attributes.action: Start charging for non-emergencies in A & E across the U.K
attributes.background:
There are too many people wasting Doctors time & resources in 
A & E Departments across the U.K. I think these non-emergencies should be charged for time wasting when these people could have gone to their GP or pharmacist to get sorted. The monies collected should then be put back into the system.

attributes.action: Ban the production and sale of non-recycled toilet paper in this country.
attributes.background: All of us use toilet paper every day.  Has it ever occurred to you that most toilet paper is made from new trees?  Recycled toilet paper is not widely available in shops in this country.  It should be the only option available because of the huge negative impact it has on the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
Here are some facts (http://www.theworldcounts.com/counters/how_consumerism_affects_the_environment/toilet_paper_environmental_impact):

- The toilet paper we use could go around the planet every 2 minutes, or travel to the sun and back every 10 days.

- The difference between using new toilet paper and toilet paper made from recycled materials is 400 million trees, 660 million tons of water, and 45 million tons of oil.

attributes.action: Conduct rolling referenda so that the Brexit deal commands support AT THE TIME
attributes.background: Older voters, who were more likely to have died by the time 'Leave' takes effect, tended to favour 'Leave', whilst those under the age of 18, who will live much longer with the consequences, didn't get a vote at all.
attributes.additional_details:
The proposal is to conduct a potentially rolling sequence of referenda to ensure that the final outcome from the Brexit negotiations reflects the widest possible support AT THE TIME THE FINAL DEAL COMES INTO EFFECT.

There are 4 options. 1. Take the deal. 2. Re-negotiate 3. Stay in the EU 4. Leave with no agreement.

The voters rank the options in order of preference.

When one option commands more than 50 percent of the votes, or if the top option is 2, re-negotiate, that's what HMG will action.

Otherwise the option with the fewest votes is eliminated, and its supporters' votes are re-allocated to their next preferences.

If option 2, re-negotiate, wins, there would have to be a further referendum 3 months later, conducted as above.

attributes.action: Change when employers can dismiss employees without cause back to one year.
attributes.background: The qualifying period for unfair dismissal increased from one to two years in April of 2012. This made it easy for a company to dismiss someone after less than two years' employment. You could work for a company for nearly two years and be dismissed for no apparent reason.
attributes.additional_details: You have no options once this happens as the company is not obligated to reinstate you, offer another position, and neither are you entitled to compensation outside their discretion which is quite often unsatisfactory. With the current system, good employees are left with no security.

attributes.action: Public enquiry into child sexual abuse and exportation in Cleveland
attributes.background: Cleveland police have investigated child sexual abuse and exploitation with little result. I believe many more people should have been charged and many people were too scared to come forward. The impact of this has devastated many people and even led to drug and alcohol problems.

attributes.action: Make A levels 3 years. This is to avoid psychological stress for young people.
attributes.background: Governments should take initiative to create this legislation as it would decrease psychological stress for young people.The psychological health of the youth is worrying with many dropping out and wanting to end their lives. We need to support the youth to create a more skilled workforce.
attributes.additional_details:
Today several aspects of young people’s quality of life and lack of well-being in this latest update has increased with over 42 .2% of 16-
19 year old experiencing anxiety which in many cases relates to education. 231 people committed suicide in 2017 due to exam stress while many other attempted to take their own life. We need to help our youth as these are the people of tomorrow. All life is precious so it must be safeguarded by us the people.

attributes.action: Fund retraining of local authority health officers at every level
attributes.background: Fully fund awareness training of local council health officers at every level to recognise their obligations to enforce prosecutions of slum rogue landlords when issuing improvement notices.Vulnerable tenants and families are placed at greater risk of exploitation by current legislation.
attributes.additional_details:
Local authories work with slum landlords by communicating direct with them instead of engaging with and involving the tenant throughout.
This process needs to be more transparent with accountability at every stage .
Private sector tenants are disenfranchised by the current legislation.
This allows slum landlords to bypass the tenants concerns and issues and communicate directly with local councils and place vulnerable tenants at risk.Council staff EHOs need more training at every level

attributes.action: Bring Home The QE2
attributes.background:
The QE2 was the last of the great liners build on Clydeside. 
In 2008 it was sold to a company in Dubai, since then it has been sitting in a dock rotting with no work been carried out on it.
I think the British Government should purchase the ship and bring it back to the Clyde. Where it Belongs.

attributes.action: Nationalise the 3rd party element of vehicle insurance to benefit young drivers.
attributes.background: My partner's daughter's insurance was £2000 per annum for any car before any accidents at the age of 18. She now has had an accident that wasn't her fault and the new premium will be £4000 per annum. She cannot use public transport to get to her job. This premium represents more than half her wages.
attributes.additional_details: Any alternative system exists in New Zealand and is quoted by Wikipedia as follows - "Within New Zealand, the Accident Compensation Corporation (ACC) provides nationwide no-fault personal injury insurance.[9] Injuries involving motor vehicles operating on public roads are covered by the Motor Vehicle Account, for which premiums are collected through levies on petrol and through vehicle licensing fees."

attributes.action: Help long term borough council foster carers move home to Care for more children
attributes.background:
I am a foster carer with over 12 years experience, having looked after over 45 children. 
I believe the government could help long serving foster carers to move to a larger home so that more children have access to good levels of care.
attributes.additional_details: The average IFA placement is over 2.5 times the cost of an in house placement for a looked after child. Meaning that if I had enough room for another LAC at home I would save the government over £500000 in the next ten years. Surely some level of investment coupled with a contract for the foster carers would be a very sound investment in the long term. I am sure that every councils IFA bill far exceeds its bill for in house carers. Let's fix this problem.

attributes.action: Stop schools being able to confiscate phones for more than the shool day.
attributes.background: Many schools confiscate phones if they are seen or heard. However the problem arises when schools confiscate a phone overnight or sometimes over multiple days. Kids should have right to bring their phones to school and also take them back at the end of the day.
attributes.additional_details: Our school has created a rule where if any phone makes a noise or is seen during the school day (including break) it will be confiscated and you will have to collect at the end of the following day. This is also the case in many other schools. Due to kids signing a 'home school agreement' which apparently gives them the right to do this. The government should assign rules that restrict schools from being allowed to take phones over night.

attributes.action: Require schools to start at 9:30 and end at 3:30.
attributes.background: Children find it extremely difficult to wake up at 7:30 and get to school by 8 or 8:30. Most children hate coming to school because of the time you have to wake up. An extra hour of sleep helps retain information and helps the child perform better at school.
attributes.additional_details: Starting school at 9:30 and ending it at 3:30 gives us 6 hours of education where students are actually awake in lessons because they have had enough time to sleep.

attributes.action: Increase the capacity of prisons by building 5 new prisons by 2022.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK over the last few years the increase of crime has put pressure onto prisons and the justice system. Therefore because there aren't enough spaces in prisons, criminals may get away with crimes they have committed. If more prisons are built, it will create more space for criminals.

attributes.action: Name one Dreadnought class submarine "HMS Thunder Child"
attributes.background: One of the new Dreadnought class submarines should be named "HMS Thunder Child" in honour of H.G. Wells' hero ship from War of the Worlds. This would infuse a sense of identity and culture being influenced by the famous literature of our nation.
attributes.additional_details: HMS Thunder Child is the fictional ironclad warship that destroys two Martian tripods in HG Wells' War of the Worlds before being sunk by a heat ray from a third tripod.

attributes.action: Make sadism a criminal offence
attributes.background:
This petition asks the government to create a new criminal offence called
 'Causing suffering for a sadistic cause'.
The act will cover all cases in which somebody deliberately physically or mentally harms a person in an unprovoked attack and then gets pleasure from their reaction/ suffering.
attributes.additional_details:
The crime will have a maximum sentence of 5 years imprisonment and will be classed in 3 rungs.

Rung A - max 5 years custody
Performing mental torture or depraved acts for a sadistic cause.

Rung B - max 2 years custody
Harming someone's mental or physical health in order to gain pleasure.

Rung C - max 6 months custody
Getting pleasure from the reaction or suffering of a person who has been mentally or physically harmed.

attributes.action: Ban the use of sequential lighting indicators on cars; they are dangerously slow
attributes.background: Sequential lighting indicators use LEDs which expand over time to show the change of direction, these take a long time and can be distracting for other drivers.

attributes.action: Allow all UK citizens to have a free NHS flu jab from September 2018 onwards
attributes.background: Many people considered 'at risk' are fortunate enough to be vaccinated for free, however not everybody is. The recent outbreak has caused lots of people to suffer and even more strain on the NHS. It is counterproductive to deny the flu jab to 'healthy' people as we are not invincible and do get flu.
attributes.additional_details:
It is possible to pay to have the jab at a pharmacy, but they are not all equal. Some are better than others.

'For otherwise healthy people, flu can be very unpleasant.' - NHS Choices. They acknowledge this is the case for those deemed not to be at risk, yet still do not offer us protection. 

'The surge sparked fresh pleas from doctors for the millions of people who have not had the winter flu jab, including those at particular risk from the virus, to get immunised urgently.' - The Guardian

attributes.action: Ban Admin Fees on Insurance Policies for Legal Need to report Change of Address
attributes.background: When people move house and need to report a legal change to their address circumstances, this should NOT be subjected to punitive fees by profiteering or hidden smallprint in contracts.
attributes.additional_details: Most insurance companies now deliver documents via PDF electronically. This no longer costs them postage. A change of address is a legal requirement (along with Driving Licence and DVLA registration) Charging people a punitive administration fee for complying with the LAW only encourages people to break the law until a policy renews. Simple address changes should be exempt from these Fees irrespective of refunds/increases in policy calculations.

attributes.action: Remove Parabens,Artificial Colour,Flavour & Preservatives from Infant Medication
attributes.background: Make all pharmaceutical companies removed parabens, all artificial colours, flavours and preservatives currently found in liquid medications, primarily used by parents for young children and especially babies. Babies should definitely not be exposed to parabens in this way.
attributes.additional_details:
Parabens have been proven to adversely affect the reproductive systems in rats and have no place in childrens medications

There is evidence that parabens and para- hydroxybenzoic acid may act as oestrogenic endocrine disruptors. Source below:
http://www.breastcanceruk.org.uk/science-and-research/parabens/
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/ruth-romano/parabens-and-breast-cance_b_15963020.html
They should not be contained in product given to babies i.e. immature reproductive system/pre puberty

attributes.action: Reform the UK prison system by adopting a more rehabilitative approach.
attributes.background: The UK prison system is failing. It does not meet the aims of punishment or prevention and doesn't even act as a deterrent as 47% of people leaving prison reoffend within a year (70% for those U18). This needs to change and we propose the change can come from more actively rehabilitating offenders..
attributes.additional_details: Rehabilitating offenders equips them with skills necessary to enter the world of employment. 50% of offenders have a reading age below 11 and 82% have a writing age below 11. To manage everyday tasks people need a reading age above 11 and so once offenders serve their sentence, they re-enter society with the same lack of skills they entered with. This means that they are likely to get involved with things that led them to prison in the first place, resulting in reoffending. Things must change!

attributes.action: Make Public Company Directors Personally Liable for Company Failures
attributes.background: In the UK we have created a corporate environment where Company Directors are rewarded for success and failure. This is different for SME owners where risk taking is offset by the potential of losing everything, including their home. We believe such rules should apply to Corporate Directors.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that there needs to be greater accountability by Public Company Directors. We believe there needs to be a change to corporate law where, to be a Company Director of a PLC (or any company on a public share exchange), individuals have to provide personal securities commensurate with the financial rewards. These securities should extend to pension provisions.
By introducing a personal element of risk to Senior Executives, irresponsible risk taking will be eliminated in our major PLCs.

attributes.action: Electrocardiogram (ECG) scans should be made compulsory for all young people.
attributes.background: Test every teenager for deadly undiagnosed heart defects that kills 12 people every week in the UK. 80% of heart defects are found through ECG scans, as there are no symptoms - meaning hundreds of lives would be saved each year. One in 500 people suffer and their hearts could stop at any point.
attributes.additional_details: Renowned cardiologist Professor Sanjay Sharma, medical director for the virgin London Marathon and Professor of Cardiology at St George's University Hospital, agrees saying: 'Each week 12 young people in the UK die suddenly from a heart condition they didn't know they had.' 'The vast majority of those - more than 80% - won't have symptoms, but the same proportion would have been picked up through a three minute ECG.'

attributes.action: Ensure Cricket Test Matches played by England are on Terrestrial TV.
attributes.background: The Secretary of State should amend the Group B list of events to include Cricket Test Matches played by England, instead of “in England”.
attributes.additional_details: It always used to be the case that sporting events of national significance had to be shown in some form (live or substantial highlights) on terrestrial television. For the first time BT has a monopoly on both live and highlight packages of the Ashes.

attributes.action: Replace the compulsory subject of RE for basic level psychology and counselling.
attributes.background: We are in the middle of a mental health revolution. The world of psychology is making advances and stigmas are being broken down in society. Mental health effects everybody either directly or indirectly and it is our duty to make sure children are given the tools needed to deal with these issues.
attributes.additional_details: In our modern day of technology wasting precious educational time and taxpayers money to teach religion is outdated. Any teenager has access to the internet where they can learn about any religion to their hearts content. Instead with this time we can introduce teens to basic level psychology. To get children asking questions, growing their knowledge on issues and learning how to deal them. Many time it takes humans a while to learn about themselves so the more headstart we can give the better.

attributes.action: The government should require all rail companies to offer part season tickets.
attributes.background: Rail prices continually increase year on year out of line with wage increases. Those working part time are forced to make a choice between accepting sky high day fares or buying season tickets which do not offer good value for money. Women and carers are disproportionately affected.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of single-use, portable BBQs
attributes.background: Disposable single-use BBQs encourage people into the countryside during good weather but recent coverage of large scale moorland fires this year illustrates their incompatibility with responsible countryside use. Using BBQ in hot, dry weather is simply not worth the risk to nature, property or life.
attributes.additional_details: This summer's significant national media coverage of moorland wildfires across the UK

attributes.action: Employers to allow employees paid time off to attend NHS blood donation
attributes.background: I recently asked to leave work for an hour to attend a local blood donation session and was declined it from a large employer. Allow staff time of work on proof of donation letter to attend local blood donation sessions to help save lives

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 13!!!
attributes.background: Teenagers should be allowed the right to vote. They are old enough to understand current world affairs and still young enough to be affected by it later on in their lives. They should be able to have a voice and decide their own future.

attributes.action: Allow the practice of euthanasia in the UK.
attributes.background: Euthanasia should be a human right for those who need and deserve the right to die. No human being deserves to suffer from an illness with no potential for recovery. It should be a choice for all critically unwell individuals if they wish to be euthanised.
attributes.additional_details:
In dire circumstances, it should be available for UK citizens to have the choice or their families to have the choice for an ill individual to die with dignity, to end suffering for the person of ill health. 
In the UK under ASPA (Animals : Scientific Procedures Act) 1986, there is a requirement to euthanise animals in order to prevent undue suffering. If this is legally viewed as a right and a requirement for mice, rats etc. why not for humans?

attributes.action: Raise parent earning limit from individual to joint to enable equal childcare
attributes.background:
Government will provide 30hours a week free childcare. 1 condition is if an individual earns <£100k. 2 parents both earning <£100k can far exceed the gross income of a family where only 1 individual earns £100k+ e.g. £95k+£60k.

Petition is to enable £200k joint before family no longer qualifies.
attributes.additional_details:
Family A 
- Parent 1 £99k 
- Parent 2 £99k 
- Total = £198k 
- Household allowed 30 hours free child care

Family B 
- Parent 1 £101k 
- Parent 2 £15k 
- Total = £116k 
- Household is NOT entitled to free childcare (despite gross income £82k less!)
- Petition to ALLOW this type of scenario to qualify for free child care

This petition will enable Family B parent 2 to increase working hours by accessing equal childcare funding.

attributes.action: Provide statutory youth services and programs.
attributes.background: There is currently no statutory obligation on local authorities to provide Youth Service Programs in respective Councils across the UK. Recently, this has meant that councils, when faced with Government austerity cuts, have had to slash services to young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to these drastic measures, many Youth Centres in the hearts of our communities have already faced forced closure and hundreds of thousands of young people now face a much-reduced range of services, support, guidance and now lack access to opportunities to acquire critical life skills. 

According to research on the government website london.gov.uk, between 2011 and 2017, at least £39 million has been slashed from council youth service budgets across London. Across 25 councils with similar data, 81 youth centres and major council-supported projects have been cut, and about 800 youth service posts are gone. 

A statutory youth program would mean that the government would proper scrutinize where the money they invest in youth channelled programs would be spent well.

attributes.action: Make cyclists require a cycling licence that they must carry at all times.
attributes.background: I have nearly been hit three times by cyclists going at high speed around corners. Cyclists never use bells anymore so silently sneak up on you and shoot past (on the pavement).
attributes.additional_details: Many people have called for regulation of cycling. This has been impractical as bikes do not need reg numbers (like cars) but this proposal is new. I propose that cyclists themselves should have to purchase a licence from the DVLA which can be revoked if guilty of dangerous cycling.

attributes.action: New high speed rail link parkway station for Maidstone
attributes.background: The HS1 link bypasses Maidstone and the town is at a disadvantage to other Kent towns in investment and travel provision. A new parkway station could be accessed from the A229 and would serve both Maidstone and the surrounding towns. There should have been a station when it was first developed.
attributes.additional_details: The HS1 high speed rail line runs north of Maidstone, providing faster travel links to Ebbslfeet and Ashford as well as towns further away such as Canterbury and Margate, but the County Town receives no benefit. Investment in Ashford and Ebbsfleet is significantly greater than Maidstone and the town still suffers from a poor and very slow train service to London compared to other towns outside of London. It takes twice as long to reach London from Maidstone than from Ashford which is ridiculous.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for urinals to have a partition that offers privacy
attributes.background: Urinating and exposing yourself in a public toilet is an uncomfortable situation at the best of times. It's time a privacy partition is installed in all toilets across the country, and give us the privacy we deserve.
attributes.additional_details:
Just because we can urinate in public, does not mean we like exposing ourselves.

Nearly 4 million people in the UK are affected by paruresis or shy bladder syndrome, which can be a physically and socially uncomfortable condition. 
 
We need to make it a legal requirement for all urinals across the country to have decent privacy and help people conquer toilet anxiety.

attributes.action: Provide armed security for the Orthodox Jewish Community in the UK
attributes.background: European governments are providing armed security for synagogues and Jewish institutions following numerous fatal terror attacks. This is because where there is a serious risk of fatalities, the only feasible solution is to provide armed security for Jewish public places. The UK must do the same.
attributes.additional_details:
The Terror threat level in Europe is getting worse, with innocent people of all races being murdered. The threat to the Jewish community is always greater, in particular when elements of the media promote anti-semitic perspectives on the Middle East conflict. The Gov't Provides armed Police for Foreign embassies and must do the same for it's own citizens who need it.

It is impossible for a policeman or security guard without a weapon to protect sites from  terrorists armed with weapons.

attributes.action: Grants for wash/dry toilets installed in households. Stop use of wipes/tissue.
attributes.background: There is currently a lot  in the media about how harmful the use of toilet wipes is on the environment and marine life. It is also costly to clear up and provide necessary protection. Providing access to grant aided/discounted wash and dry toilets should help to greatly minimise this. SaveOurPlanet!

attributes.action: Demand a pay cut of £13,612 of all MLAs in Northern Ireland
attributes.background: There has been deadlock in Stormont with key players obstructing negotiations since the assembly collapse. Public services are suffering due to the collapse while public servants receive full pay. This is unreasonable!
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-northern-ireland-42418944
I z http://www.itv.com/news/utv/2018-03-13/bradley-rejects-claims-of-dithering-over-mla-pay/

attributes.action: Make it illegal to have alcohol at school events in which children are present.
attributes.background: Alcohol plays far too big a part in society as it is. Alcohol is a grown up thing that children should not be part of. By having alcohol at children's school events we are not only weakening the safeguarding of the children attending, but also showing them that we drink to have a good time.
attributes.additional_details:
Adults should be leading by good example. You can't teach responsible drinking while drinking in front of them. It should be respected that there are parents that want to raise their children in alcohol free environments. 
1 in 5 children are affected by a parents drinking this also needs to be taken into consideration, for some of those children school is a safe and fun environment. 
There is no argument for alcohol at schools, other than "we want it" However there are many disadvantages to it.

attributes.action: Make a law on age for babysitting and being left home alone
attributes.background: As confusing as it is some people think it's wrong to let teenagers under 16 look after their siblings or other young children, whilst others see no harm As it can be good to trust these days and at other times there are risks..
attributes.additional_details:
Do we educate our children how to deal with emergencies when they arise or how to cook their own food without setting fire to the kitchen.
Just think a law should be in place to protect not only the children but others around and make it a legal age to babysit

attributes.action: Ban hunting for pheasants and other game birds. It is very cruel.
attributes.background: Hunting pheasants is just as bad as fox hunting in my opinion. This is a very very cruel sport. The poor birds are treated very badly and this needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: There are many videos on YouTube which show how these poor birds suffer. Why? All for the entertainment of huntsmen. How would they feel? To be shot and left for dead?

attributes.action: Minimum 5 year sentence for possession of Offensive Weapons in a public place.
attributes.background: The current sentencing tariffs are insufficient and ineffective as a deterrent. On first offence, a minimum sentence of 6 months custody which may be suspended for 5 years, depending on specific circumstance. On second offence, a minimum sentence of 5 years custody, with no option of early release.
attributes.additional_details:
Current CPS sentencing guidance for 16-17 year olds, is set to 4 months minimum detention and a training order, in the worst scenarios: ( https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/offensive-weapons-knives-bladed-and-pointed-articles ) Clearly, this is not a deterrent.
The proposed tariffs would apply to all ages. To ensure the new tariffs are clear, a campaign to publicise them to the target audience (10 years old and above suggested) should be conducted through National & local media.

attributes.action: Give a bursary to those people wanting to train to teach drama
attributes.background: “Acting is behaving truthfully under imaginary circumstances.” - Sanford Meisner. Drama is a subject where students are creative, present in the moment and help them to understand their existence, both physically and emotionally. Teacher training is funded for several other subjects - why not drama?

attributes.action: Require 5-year warranty on electrical goods to reduce environmental impact
attributes.background: White goods, TVs and other electrical items often break shortly after their warranty has expired and are often not economically viable to repair. Manufacturers should have to take greater care to ensure these items are better quality and fit for use for many years to reduce the environmental impact.

attributes.action: Urge Thameslink not to makes changes to timetable
attributes.background: Thameslink are planning in May to change the timetables which will mean that commuters will be delayed with for work etc
